title: Nuggets' Jokic limps off court after injuring knee
content: Nuggets star Nikola Jokic limped off the court at halftime of Denver's game in Miami on Monday night after injuring his left knee with about three seconds left before the intermission. He will have an MRI on Tuesday, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Chargers rest Herbert; Lance to start vs. Broncos
content: The Chargers will rest quarterback Justin Herbert for Sunday's regular-season finale, with Trey Lance getting the start against the Broncos.

title: Riley won't return as Clemson OC after 7-6 season
content: Two days after the season ended with a 22-10 loss to Penn State in the Pinstripe Bowl, Clemson coach Dabo Swinney announced Monday that offensive coordinator Garrett Riley and safeties coach Mickey Conn will not return to the Tigers' program next season.

title: Ex-boxing champ Joshua hurt in crash, two killed
content: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua was hospitalized in Nigeria after being involved in a car crash that killed two people who were team members.

title: DE Jacobs, No. 11 in ESPN 300, picks Ohio State
content: Two days before Ohio State opens its College Football Playoff run with a quarterfinal bout against Miami, Ryan Day and the Buckeyes got a five-star commitment Monday from 2027 defensive end D.J. Jacobs, the No. 11 overall prospect in the ESPN Junior 300.

title: Father of NASCAR's Hamlin dies after house fire
content: Denny Hamlin's father died and his mother was critically injured after a weekend fire heavily damaged the North Carolina home where they lived.

content: Ole Miss running back Kewan Lacy is listed as probable to play against No. 3 Georgia in Thursday's CFP quarterfinal at the Allstate Sugar Bowl.

title: 1 Dead After Speeding Thar Runs Over Men Sitting Near Bonfire In Meerut
content: One person died and two were critically injured when a speeding SUV ran over them while they were warming themselves by a bonfire on the roadside in Meerut district on Sunday night, police said.

title: Khaleda Zia, Former Bangladesh PM And BNP Chief, Dies At 80
content: Bangladesh's former prime minister, Begum Khaleda Zia, has died of prolonged illness while under treatment at Dhaka's Apollo Hospital.

title: Bangladesh Updates: 3-Time PM Khaleda Zia Dies After Prolonged Illness
content: Begum Khaleda Zia, former Bangladesh prime minister and the chairperson of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), has died of prolonged illness while under treatment at Dhaka's Apollo Hospital. She was 80.

title: Khaleda Zia: Bangladesh's 1st Woman PM Who Had An India Connection
content: Khaleda Zia, Bangladesh's first woman prime minister, died at the age of 80 on Tuesday after a prolonged illness, her Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) said in a statement.

title: Mumbai Civic Body Polls: BJP To Contest 137 Seats, Shiv Sena 90
content: Ruling allies BJP and Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena will contest 137 and 90 seats, respectively, in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation polls.

title: Telangana Police Warns Of 'Greeting Scams' Ahead Of New Year Celebrations
content: In an era where a simple emoji or a festive GIF is the standard way to ring in the New Year, the Telangana Cyber Security Bureau has issued a chilling reminder: that heart-warming greeting from a "friend" might actually be a digital Trojan Horse.

title: 4 Dead, 9 Injured After Mumbai's Reversing BEST Bus Crashes Into Pedestrians
content: Four people were killed after they were hit by a BEST bus while it was reversing in Mumbai tonight. Nine others were injured. The incident happened in Mumbai's Bhandup.

title: Mumbai Civic Body Polls: Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena Distributes AB Forms
content: The Shiv Sena (UBT) on Monday began distributing AB forms to party candidates for the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls, even as it did not release the official list, fearing a rebellion.

title: "Will Knock The Hell Out": Trump Threatens Iran Over Nuclear Enrichment
content: President Donald Trump warned Iran against reconstituting its nuclear program Monday as he welcomed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to his home in Florida for wide-ranging talks.

title: Ex-Air Force Officer Beaten To Death By Daughter-In-Law Over Property Dispute
content: A 32-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly beating her elderly father-in-law to death over property dispute in southwest Delhi's Bindapur area, police said on Monday.

title: Ghaziabad Police Arrest 6 Hindu Raksha Dal Activists For Distributing Swords
content: Police on Monday arrested six activists of Hindu Raksha Dal for distributing over two dozen swords in Shalimar Garden colony, a police official said.

title: Bangladesh Envoy To India Reaches Dhaka On "Urgent" Summons: Report
content: Bangladesh High Commissioner to India Reaz Hamidullah reached Dhaka overnight following an "urgent call" from the foreign ministry amid strained bilateral ties, reports said late Monday.

title: Trump Says He Was "Very Angry" Over Alleged Ukraine Attack On Putin Residence
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday said Russian President Vladimir Putin told him Ukraine tried to attack Putin's residence in northern Russia, which Kyiv has denied.

title: At UN, US Defends Israel's Recognition Of Somaliland
content: The United States defended Israel's right to recognize the breakaway territory of Somaliland at the United Nations on Monday, comparing it to the recognition of a Palestinian state by numerous countries.

title: Hamas Has "Short Period Of Time" To Disarm, Warns Trump
content: US President Donald Trump warned Monday that Hamas would have "hell to pay" if it does not disarm quickly as part of the Gaza deal, which he said Israel was complying with.

title: Netanyahu Announces Israel Peace Prize For Trump After Florida Talks: Report
content: US President Donald Trump will be awarded Israel's highest civilian honour, the Israel Prize for Peace, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced on Monday, following a bilateral meeting between the two leaders in Florida, CNN reported.

title: Video: US Says 2 Killed In Strike On Suspected Drug Vessel In Pacific
content: The US military said it killed two men in a strike on a boat suspected of carrying drugs in international waters in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Monday.

title: US Announces $8.6 Billion Boeing Contract For F-15 Jets For Israel
content: Boeing was given an $8.6 billion contract for the F-15 Israel Program, the Pentagon said on Monday, after US President Donald Trump met Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Florida.

title: About 170 Sheep Mysteriously Die In UP, Yogi Adityanath Orders Probe
content: Around 170 sheep died under mysterious circumstances near Rashtriya Prerna Sthal in Lucknow, prompting police to send samples for testing to determine the cause of death, as authorities assess whether disease, poisoning or negligence may be involved.

title: Critically Ill Former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia's Condition Worsens: Report
content: Critically ill former prime minister and Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chairperson Khaleda Zia's condition has worsened and she is being treated at a specialised private hospital in the capital, reports quoting her doctors said late Sunday.

title: 'Big discussion on West Bank': What went down at Trump & Netanyahu's meeting; key takeaways
content: President Trump and Prime Minister Netanyahu met at Mar-a-Lago, presenting a united front but revealing no concrete progress on the Gaza ceasefire's second phase. Trump made some contested claims about potential pardon for Netanyahu, which Israel's presidency disputed, whereas he also went on to issue warnings for Hamas and Iran.

title: Bangladesh: Former PM & BNP chairman Khaleda Zia passes away at 80
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) chairperson and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia has died at the age of 80. A dominant political figure for decades, Zia had been in critical condition for months. She served as prime minister twice, first becoming the nation's first female premier in 1991.

title: Delhi air pollution: At 390, city's AQI in ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô category; dense fog reduces visibility
content: Delhi started its day on Tuesday shrouded in heavy fog, which severely impaired visibility and created chaotic traffic conditions. The air quality dropped to alarming levels, reaching both 'very poor' and 'severe' status.

title: T20 World Cup snub: 'It's not the end of the road' ‚Äî ex-India spinner backs Shubman Gill
content: Indian selectors have dropped Shubman Gill from the 2026 T20 World Cup squad, citing his recent form slump. Despite this, former spinner Harbhajan Singh believes it's not an end for Gill, highlighting the intense competition. Suryakumar Yadav retains captaincy, with selectors backing his ability to deliver. Axar Patel is vice-captain, and Ishan Kishan returns.

title: Karnataka: Man forces 3-year-old to drink alcohol at bar; excise dept steps in
content: A three-year-old boy was allegedly made to consume alcohol at a bar in Belagavi district, sparking outrage. The excise department has vowed action against Pritam Bar and Restaurant for allowing the minor and violating liquor laws. The elderly man responsible faces severe penalties under the Juvenile Justice Act.

title: Deal gone wrong: US tech company drags acquisition adviser to court; alleges fee-driven bad advice
content: A tech firm, SmarTek21, is suing its advisor, TGP GP Management, alleging it was misled into a $5.2 million acquisition of IT Avalon. SmarTek21 claims TGP rushed the deal despite concerns about IT Avalon's finances, which have since required significant cash infusions. TGP, however, denies the allegations, asserting thorough due diligence and a strong business outlook for the combined entity.

title: 2 Mondays, a year apart: BEST bus mows down 4, injures 14 in Mumbai; driver suspended
content: Bhandup West faced a devastating tragedy when a BEST bus driver, during a U-turn, lost control, resulting in the tragic deaths of four individuals and injuries to fourteen pedestrians. The electric AC bus careened off the road, striking a pole before impacting innocent bystanders.

title: Another US strike, two more dead: Anti-drug campaign toll crosses 100 ‚Äî watch
content: US forces killed two suspected "male narco-terrorists" in a strike on an alleged drug-smuggling boat in the Eastern Pacific. This brings the total killed in Washington's campaign to at least 107. The military claims intelligence confirmed the vessel's involvement in drug trafficking, though evidence for the strikes remains unprovided, sparking debate over legality.

title: From lab to YouTube: Google AI CEO celebrates The Thinking Game; 200 million views in four weeks
content: Google DeepMind's documentary, 'The Thinking Game,' has captivated audiences, surpassing 200 million YouTube views in just four weeks.  This compelling film offers an inside look at the groundbreaking work of an AGI lab, highlighting the journey behind Nobel Prize-winning projects like AlphaFold.  CEO Demis Hassabis celebrated the film's immense success and praised the talented creators behind it.

title: Just 62 runs away: Smriti Mandhana set to surpass Shubman Gill; this record in sight
content: Mandhana‚Äôs run-scoring at the top of the order has played a key role in India Women‚Äôs results this season. She has scored runs in different formats and conditions while setting up innings for the team.

title: 'Where are the captains?': AI, IndiGo in dogfight for pilots; joining bonus up to Rs 50 lakh
content: As Indian airlines face a dwindling pool of pilots due to updated flight duty regulations, IndiGo and Air India are ramping up their recruitment efforts. IndiGo, in particular, is set to hire 100 new pilots this January, with captains receiving enticing signing bonuses that could soar to ‚Çπ50 lakh.

title: Chinese billionaire‚Äôs plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 children
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: Who were Latif Ayodele and Sina Ghami? Tragedy strikes Anthony Joshua
content: Anthony Joshua is recovering in hospital after a fatal road crash in Nigeria claimed the lives of two of his closest friends, Latif Ayodele and Sina Ghami. The pair were integral members of his team, serving as personal trainer and strength coach. Joshua survived the collision and remains in a stable condition as investigations continue.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 25: Ranveer Singh starrer scores Rs 1078 crore worldwide haul
content: Dhurandhar, the spy-thriller starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, is a massive box office success. The film has crossed Rs 701 crore in India and Rs 1078 crore worldwide. It has surpassed Kalki 2898 AD and Pathaan in collections. Dhurandhar is now chasing Jawan's lifetime earnings and is set to become the biggest Bollywood grosser.

title: Travis Kelce admits he let Andy Reid down amid Chiefs‚Äô tough season
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
content: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
content: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: First land strike? US hits drug boat loading facility in Venezuela; tensions set to rise
content: President Trump revealed a US operation targeting a drug loading area in Venezuela, marking a potential escalation in land-based actions.  He described a "major explosion" hitting boats and the implementation site.  Details remain scarce, with US agencies and the Venezuelan government declining comment, fueling speculation about covert activities amid a significant Caribbean military buildup.

title: 'Next one won't come': Mandhana's warning; cautions against living off past success
content: She said the team remains a work in progress and that thinking too much about the recent ODI World Cup win will not help future results.

title: Kannada TV actress Nandini CM dies by suicide in Bengaluru
content: Kannada television actor Nandini CM, 26, was found dead by suicide at her Bengaluru PG accommodation. Police registered an Unnatural Death Report after friends and staff discovered her hanging. A diary entry revealed her passion for acting and reluctance towards a government job offered after her father's death.

title: 2-year high: Industrial output growth surges; at 6.7% in Nov
content: Industrial output surged to a 25-month high in November, driven by a strong rebound in manufacturing and mining sectors. Consumer durables and non-durables also showed robust expansion, signaling a positive consumption scenario. Capital goods output also maintained healthy momentum, indicating sustained investment activity.

title: ‚ÄòIsrael wouldn't exist today without you‚Äô: Trump hosts Netanyahu; praises Israeli PM
content: US President Donald Trump stated that Israel would not exist today without Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, praising his leadership during a meeting. Trump also warned Iran against rebuilding nuclear facilities. Netanyahu reciprocated the praise, calling Trump an unparalleled friend to Israel and the free world.

title: 'I solved 8 wars, how about India and Pakistan': Trump meets Netanyahu; repeats claims on hot mic
content: US President Donald Trump again claimed he resolved the India-Pakistan conflict, stating he mediated an "immediate" ceasefire. However, India maintains the cessation of hostilities was a result of direct military talks, with Prime Minister Modi clarifying no foreign leader requested India to halt its operations.

title: Arson attack: Man-made Assam green cover targeted; created by 'forest man' Jadav Payeng
content: Miscreants set fire to the Molai Kathoni 2.0 forest, a vital green cover cultivated by Jadav Payeng and his daughter on a Brahmaputra sandbar. The blaze caused extensive damage, destroying bird nests and impacting wildlife, despite efforts by Payeng's daughter and villagers to control the flames. This incident highlights ongoing threats to the protected area.

title: No war in Pawar 'parivar': From split to civic poll pact - the NCP saga explained
content: The Ajit Pawar-led NCP and the Sharad Pawar faction will contest local elections in Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune together. This alliance is a local arrangement for the civic polls. The decision was made after consulting party workers. This development has raised questions within the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance.

title: Mumbai: 4 killed, 10 injured as BEST bus hits passengers; driver detained
content: A reversing BEST bus tragically struck pedestrians on Station Road in Bhandup (West) late Monday night, resulting in at least four fatalities and ten injuries. Emergency services responded swiftly, transporting the injured to local hospitals. The exact cause of the devastating accident is currently under investigation.

title: Cargo ship or warship? China's sinister Taiwan war plan revealed - see pics
content: China is transforming its cargo ship, Zhongda 79, into an arsenal ship, equipping it with containerized launchers for up to 60 missiles. This upgrade, featuring advanced weaponry including hypersonic missiles, signifies Beijing's push to bolster its naval capabilities and match the US Navy's vertical launch systems. The vessel's transformation highlights China's growing maritime ambitions.

title: Who is Nick Shirley? YouTuber behind viral Minnesota daycare fraud probe
content: Nick Shirley is a YouTuber whose video alleging daycare fraud in Minnesota went viral on December 26. He claims some centers received millions despite appearing inactive. His video drew attention from Congressman Tom Emmer, who questioned Governor Tim Walz. All claims against YouTuber remain allegations, with no official response yet.

title: Ayesha Curry says she felt 'disrespected' by women pursuing Stephen Curry
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, has often gotten brutally trolled for some of her controversial comments. Amid this, the popular entrepreneur opened up about her insecurities as women have tried to pursue the Golden State Warriors' star player, Stephen Curry, even though he has been married for fourteen years now. Ayesha Curry talks about what she felt and how she navigates through this complicated journey.

title: 'We're worried': What SC said on convict Sengar's bail; the 'public servant' question
content: The Supreme Court has intervened in the Unnao rape case. It has halted the Delhi high court's decision to suspend former BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence. The apex court is examining if an MLA qualifies as a public servant under the POCSO Act. This move ensures Sengar remains in jail. The survivor welcomes the Supreme Court's action.

title: NFL futures: Rams still Super Bowl favorites; 49ers close gap
content: Through 17 weeks of the NFL season, the  Los Angeles Rams  are the favorite to win the Super Bowl at +475. Right behind them are the  Seattle Seahawks  at +500. The  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl at +750. They are followed by the  New England Patriots  at +900. The  San Francisco 49ers  are next at +950 following their wild victory Sunday night. The Seahawks and 49ers meet in Week 18. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Aston Villa's 11th straight win might be the most impressive. Plus: Inter must sharpen up
content: Aston Villa beat Chelsea 2-1 in the premier league on saturday . it was a battle of top four teams after which aston villa might legitimately be entering the title race alongside arsenal and manchester city . however, they're going to need to sharpen up if they want to run away with the Scudetto .

title: Paperless: J&K govt takes green leap; saves 4.5 lakh trees
content: study by shhid Iqbal Choudhary shows govt's move from paper files to digital systems has helped avoid more than 62,000 tonnes of carbon dioxide emissions . the study is published by the journal of research in environmental and earth sciences .
